p: Prenatal ultrasound was performed at least once in all but three women (160/163; 98.2%). Second trimester ultrasound was normal in all but five cases (three with brain malformations associated with CZS, one congenital heart disease associated with a 22q11 deletion syndrome, and one termination of pregnancy (TOP) due to CZS). Neurologic magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) was performed on 43 (26.4%) pregnant women; three showed fetal CNS abnormalities (3/43; 7%): two of the CZS cases, and one infant with proportionate microcephaly born at 40 weeks of gestation that was lost-to-follow-up after first postnatal visit.
